decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - This permission is for a limited period of 12 months expiring on 21/05/2025, and the proposed use of the home office for medical practise should be returned to its former residential use on or prior to 21/05/2024, unless further permission is granted by the local planning authority. 
Reason: In order to assess the impact of the proposal on neighbouring residential amenity, in accordance with policy LP2 of the Wandsworth Local Plan (2023). 
Condition : 2 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the reports, specifications and drawings detailed 01 V1, 03 V1, 05 V1, 07 V1, Planning Statement by Planning by Design, Email dated 24.04.2024.
Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of development and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme. 
Condition : 3 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) or any Order revoking, amending and re-enacting the Order the development hereby approved shall only relate to the room as identified as 'home office' on drawing No.05/V1 and it shall be used only as 'home office for the practise of medicine' (sui generis) and for no other purpose. 
Reason: To retain the main use of the flat for residential purposes and to safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood by ensuring that other uses which could cause a loss of amenity do not commence without prior approval in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework.
Condition : 4 - The use hereby permitted shall not be open to customers other than between the hours of:
0900 - 1800 Mondays - Fridays 
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood, in accordance with Council policy LP2 of the Local Plan  coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework.
Condition : 5 - INFORMATIVE: In dealing with this application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive manner and the Council has, as far as practicable, sought solutions to problems arising in relation to dealing with the planning application. The Council has made available detailed advice in the form of its statutory policies in the Local Plan (2023) as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably. In addition, where appropriate, further guidance was offered to the applicant during the processing of the application.
description: Change of use of a room within the property to allow for home office to practise medicine (sui generis).
